definitions.definition: Any of the 20 species of the genus Galanthus of the Amaryllidaceae, bulbous flowering plants, bearing a solitary, pendulous, white, bell-shaped flower that appears, depending on species, between autumn and late winter or early spring, all native to temperate Eurasia.
To steal clothing (especially women's underwear) from a clothesline.
Any of a variety of Spanish sports played against a wall.
A ship used to transport people, smaller vehicles and goods from one port to another, usually on a regular schedule.
A place where passengers are transported across water in such a ship.
The legal right or franchise that entitles a corporate body or an individual to operate such a service.
To carry; transport; convey.
definitions.example: Trucks plowed through the water to ferry flood victims to safety.

definitions.definition: To move someone or something from one place to another, usually repeatedly.
definitions.example: Being a good waiter takes more than the ability to ferry plates of food around a restaurant.

definitions.definition: To carry or transport over a contracted body of water, as a river or strait, in a boat or other floating conveyance plying between opposite shores.
To pass over water in a boat or by ferry.
The first section of the Christian New Testament scripture, comprising the books of Matthew, Mark, Luke and John, concerned with the life, crucifixion, death, resurrection, and teachings of Jesus.
An account of the life, crucifixion, death, resurrection, and teachings of Jesus, generally written during the first several centuries of the Common Era.
The teaching of Divine grace as distinguished from the Law or Divine commandments.
A message expected to have positive reception or effect, one promoted as offering important (or even infalliable) guiding principles.
That which is absolutely authoritative (definitive).
Gospel music.
To instruct in the gospel.
To allow to be used by someone temporarily, on condition that it or its equivalent will be returned.
definitions.example: I lent her 10 euros to pay for the train tickets, and she paid me back the next day.

definitions.definition: To make a loan.
To be suitable or applicable, to fit.
definitions.example: Poems do not lend themselves to translation easily.

definitions.definition: To afford; to grant or furnish in general.
definitions.example: Can you lend me some assistance?

definitions.definition: To borrow.
The action of, or an instance of the action of the verb to lend.
That lends.
definitions.example: a lending library

definitions.definition: An older person or an older member, usually a leader, of some community.
definitions.example: We were presented to the village elder.

definitions.definition: One who is older than another.
definitions.example: Respect your elders.

definitions.definition: One who lived at an earlier period; a predecessor.
An officer of a church, sometimes having teaching responsibilities.
A clergyman authorized to administer all the sacraments.
definitions.example: a travelling elder

definitions.definition: One ordained to the lowest office in the Melchizedek priesthood.
definitions.example: After being a member of the Church for a while, Bill was ordained to the office of elder.

definitions.definition: Male missionary.
definitions.example: The elders are coming over for dinner tonight.

definitions.definition: (often capitalized) Title for a male missionary; title for a general authority.
definitions.example: One of the long-time leaders in the Church is Elder Packer.

definitions.definition: A pagan or Heathen priest or priestess.
To admonish or reprove for improper conduct by the elders of the meeting.
definitions.example: I was eldered for directly responding to someone else's message in meeting for worship.

definitions.definition: Of an object, concept, relationship, etc., having existed for a relatively long period of time.
definitions.example: an old abandoned building;  an old friend

definitions.definition: Having been used and thus no longer new or unused.
definitions.example: I find that an old toothbrush is good to clean the keyboard with.

definitions.definition: Having existed or lived for the specified time.
definitions.example: How old are they? She’s five years old and he's seven. We also have a young teen and a two-year-old child.

definitions.definition: (heading) Of an earlier time.
Tiresome after prolonged repetition.
definitions.example: Your constant pestering is getting old.

definitions.definition: Said of subdued colors, particularly reds, pinks and oranges, as if they had faded over time.
A grammatical intensifier, often used in describing something positive. (Mostly in idioms like good old, big old and little old, any old and some old.)
definitions.example: We're having a good old time. My next car will be a big old SUV.  My wife makes the best little old apple pie in Texas.

definitions.definition: Excessive, abundant.
A small tree, Sambucus nigra, having white flowers in a cluster, and edible purple berries
Any of the other species of the genus Sambucus: small trees, shrubs or herbaceous perennials with red, purple, or white/yellow berries (some of which are poisonous).
The tendency to reduce a religion to its most fundamental tenets, based on strict interpretation of core texts.
(by extension) A rigid conformity to any set of basic tenets.
The belief that fundamental financial quantities are the best predictor of the price of a financial instrument.
To provide with gearing; to fit with gears in order to achieve a desired gear ratio.
To be in, or come into, gear.
To dress; to put gear on; to harness.
(usually with to or toward(s)) To design or devise (something) so as to be suitable (for a particular type of person or a particular purpose).
definitions.example: They have geared the hotel mainly at tourists.

definitions.definition: To borrow money in order to invest it in assets.
The ratio of a system of gears.
definitions.example: The 4×4 could climb well, as it had relatively low gearing.

definitions.definition: Harness; working implements.
A train of toothed wheels and pinions.
An outdoor area or a building where cars may be parked.
A road with serious traffic congestion preventing the movement of vehicles.
Any of several perennial composite plants, especially of genera Cirsium, Carduus, Cynara, or Onopordum, having prickly leaves and showy flower heads with prickly bracts.
This plant seen as the national emblem of Scotland.
This plant used as a charge.
The Order of the Thistle, or membership thereof.
The act of corroborating, strengthening, or confirming; addition of strength; confirmation
That which corroborates.
To make into a mummy, by preserving a dead body.
To become a mummy.
An artist who draws pictures on the pavement, often hoping to get donations from the passers-by.
A specialist in outdoor surveillance as a pedestrian.
A vessel for brewing and serving tea.
The totality of player experiences during a game, such as the gaming environment and the competitive interaction with other players; often with reference to a video game.
Any integer which is the product of some integer with the integer itself.
definitions.example: 36 is a square number being the product of 6 and 6 itself.

definitions.definition: The appearance of Jesus Christ to the Magi on the twelfth day after Christmas.
An annual Christian feast celebrating this event.
The day of the celebration, January 6th, or sometimes (in Western Christianity), the Sunday between January 2nd and 8th.

The season or time of the Christian church year either from the Epiphany feast day to Shrove Tuesday (the day before Ash Wednesday, the start of Lent) or from the Epiphany feast day to the feast of the Presentation of Christ in the Temple.
An illuminating realization or discovery, often resulting in a personal feeling of elation, awe, or wonder.
definitions.example: It came to her in an epiphany what her life's work was to be.

definitions.definition: A manifestation or appearance of a divine or superhuman being.
A noun which refers to something that can be counted. Examples: house, car, bush, point.
A Sikh place of worship.
(of food, drink, or other consumable) Causing one to want to have more.
To ride a surfboard that has an attached sail
The process whereby one item splits to become two.
Short for nuclear fission: The process of splitting the nucleus of an atom into smaller particles.
The process by which a bacterium splits to form two daughter cells.
To cause to undergo fission.
To undergo fission.
The process of decompressing.
definitions.example: The decompression of large data files may take a while.

definitions.definition: The restoration to atmospheric pressure of a person who has spent time under higher pressure (such as a diver)
Mode of operation of some internal combustion engines that makes them easier to start, but significantly increases fuel consumption.
The relief of pressure on a body part by surgery
A place where sperm from donors is stored for future use in artificial insemination.
The vagina.
A video recording of an action that can be replayed immediately after being recorded.
Having a hardness and severity of nature or manner.
Grim and forbidding in appearance.
The rear part or after end of a ship or vessel.
The post of management or direction.
The hinder part of anything.
The tail of an animal; now used only of the tail of a dog.
A bird, the black tern.
A friend; a pal.
definitions.example: I ran into an old chum from school the other day.

definitions.definition: A roommate, especially in a college or university.
To share rooms with someone; to live together.
To lodge (somebody) with another person or people.
To make friends; to socialize.
To accompany.
definitions.example: I'll chum you down to the shops.

definitions.definition: A mixture of (frequently rancid) fish parts and blood, dumped into the water to attract predator fish, such as sharks
To cast chum into the water to attract fish.
A coarse mould for holding the clay while being worked on a whirler, lathe or manually.
To allow to, not to prevent (+ infinitive, but usually without to).
definitions.example: After he knocked for hours, I decided to let him come in.

definitions.definition: To leave.
definitions.example: Let me alone!

definitions.definition: To allow the release of (a fluid).
definitions.example: The physicians let about a pint of his blood, but to no avail.

definitions.definition: To allow possession of (a property etc.) in exchange for rent.
definitions.example: I decided to let the farmhouse to a couple while I was working abroad.

definitions.definition: To give, grant, or assign, as a work, privilege, or contract; often with out.
definitions.example: to let the building of a bridge;  to let out the lathing and the plastering

definitions.definition: Used to introduce an imperative in the first or third person.
definitions.example: Let P be the point where AB and OX intersect.

definitions.definition: To cause (+ bare infinitive).
definitions.example: Can you let me know what time you'll be arriving?

definitions.definition: To hinder, prevent, impede, hamper, cumber; to obstruct (someone or something).
To prevent someone from doing something; also to prevent something from happening.
To tarry or delay.
The rental of accommodation.
The award of a public contract
A mathematical science concerned with data collection, presentation, analysis, and interpretation.
definitions.example: Statistics is the only mathematical field required for many social sciences.

definitions.definition: A systematic collection of data on measurements or observations, often related to demographic information such as population counts, incomes, population counts at different ages, etc.
definitions.example: The statistics from the Census for apportionment are available.

definitions.definition: Attributes of a unit in a game (e.g. health, damage output)
definitions.example: Those items he bought really boosted his stats.

definitions.definition: Fear or hatred of transsexuality or transgenderism, or of trans individuals.
The preference of pairs of high-trans effect soft ligands to avoid being mutually trans by becoming cis and having other low-trans effect hard ligands trans to themselves.
A derisive cry or shout.
The cry of an owl.
A fun event or person. (See hootenanny)
A small particle.
To cry out or shout in contempt.
To make the cry of an owl, a hoo.
To assail with contemptuous cries or shouts; to follow with derisive shouts.
To sound the horn of a vehicle
A machine, usually automatic, which washes clothes, etc.
A celestial body consisting mainly of ice, dust and gas in a (usually very eccentric) orbit around the Sun and having a "tail" of matter blown back from it by the solar wind as it approaches the Sun.
A celestial phenomenon with the appearance given by the orbiting celestial body.
Any of several species of hummingbird found in the Andes.
An indivisible unit of sound in a given language. A phoneme is an abstraction of the physical speech sounds (phones) and may encompass several different phones.
A system consisting of the parts of an engine through which burned gases or steam are discharged; see also exhaust system.
The steam let out of a cylinder after it has done its work there.
The dirty air let out of a room through a register or pipe provided for the purpose.
An exhaust pipe, especially on a motor vehicle.
Exhaust gas.
To draw or let out wholly; to drain off completely
definitions.example: Moisture of the earth is exhausted by evaporation.

definitions.definition: To empty by drawing or letting out the contents
definitions.example: to exhaust a treasury

definitions.definition: To drain; to use up or expend wholly, or until the supply comes to an end
definitions.example: I exhausted my strength walking up the hill.

definitions.definition: To tire out; to wear out; to cause to be without any energy
definitions.example: The marathon exhausted me.

definitions.definition: To bring out or develop completely
To discuss thoroughly or completely
definitions.example: That subject has already been fully exhausted.

definitions.definition: To subject to the action of various solvents in order to remove all soluble substances or extractives
definitions.example: to exhaust a drug successively with water, alcohol, and ether

definitions.definition: Exhausted; used up.
A freeway that encircles a city.
A penalty for or consequence of a misdemeanor.
A thing forfeited; that which is taken from somebody in requital of a misdeed committed; that which is lost, or the right to which is alienated, by a crime, breach of contract, etc.
definitions.example: He who murders pays the forfeit of his own life.

definitions.definition: Something deposited and redeemable by a sportive fine as part of a game.
Injury; wrong; mischief.
To suffer the loss of something by wrongdoing or non-compliance
definitions.example: He forfeited his last chance of an early release from jail by repeatedly attacking another inmate.

definitions.definition: To lose a contest, game, match, or other form of competition by voluntary withdrawal, by failing to attend or participate, or by violation of the rules
definitions.example: Because only nine players were present, the football team was forced to forfeit the game.

definitions.definition: To be guilty of a misdeed; to be criminal; to transgress.
To fail to keep an obligation.
Lost or alienated for an offense or crime; liable to penal seizure.
A German sourdough bread made from rye.
Rough, aggressive; powerful and successful.
Excellent, first-class.
A criminal activity in which people are recruited, harboured, transported, bought, or kidnapped to serve an exploitative purpose, such as sexual slavery, forced labor, or child soldiery.
A carnivorous aquatic mammal in one of several families of order Cetacea, famed for its intelligence and occasional willingness to approach humans.
A fish, the mahi-mahi or dorado, Coryphaena hippurus, with a dorsal fin that runs the length of the body, also known for iridescent coloration.
A depiction of a fish, with a broad indented fin, usually embowed.
The dauphin, eldest son of the kings of France.
(history) A mass of iron or lead hung from the yardarm, in readiness to be dropped through the deck and the hull of an enemy's vessel to sink it.
A kind of wreath or strap of plaited cordage.
A spar or buoy held by an anchor and furnished with a ring to which ships may fasten their cables.
A mooring post on a wharf or beach.
A permanent fender around a heavy boat just below the gunwale.
One of the handles above the trunnions by which a gun was lifted.

A man-made semi submerged maritime structure, usually installed to provide a fixed structure for temporary mooring, to prevent ships from drifting to shallow water or to serve as base for navigational aids.
An ardent enthusiast or admirer.
definitions.example: He was a devotee of Arnold Schwarzenegger.

definitions.definition: A fanatical or zealous believer in a particular religion or god.
definitions.example: devotees of Krishna

definitions.definition: Someone with an amputee fetish.
The amount of work assigned to a particular worker, normally in a specified time period
The amount of work that a machine can handle or produce
A sound made with the glottis
Of or relating to the glottis.
Articulated with the glottis.
The mathematics of numbers (integers, rational numbers, real numbers, or complex numbers) under the operations of addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division.
Of, relating to, or using arithmetic; arithmetical.
definitions.example: arithmetic geometry

definitions.definition: Of a progression, mean, etc, computed solely using addition.
definitions.example: arithmetic progression

definitions.definition: A preventative medical regiment of HIV medicines used to protect against HIV seroconversion after an exposure.
definitions.example: Some doctors will prescribe pre-exposure prophylaxis to promiscuous people that have a hard time controlling themselves or their condom usage to prevent them from getting AIDS.

definitions.definition: Preparation.
A prep school.
A student or graduate of a prep school, a preppy.
Homework, work set to do outside class time, used widely in public schools and preparatory schools but not state schools.
Preparatory level; the last two levels or the fourth and fifth years of preschool; the two levels before first grade.
To prepare.

(grammar, strict sense) Any of a class of non-inflecting words typically employed to connect a following noun or a pronoun, in an adjectival or adverbial sense, with some other word: a particle used with a noun or pronoun (in English always in the objective case) to make a phrase limiting some other word.
A proposition; an exposition; a discourse.
A counter or sideboard from which food and drinks are served or may be bought.
Food laid out in this way, to which diners serve themselves.
A small stool; a stool for a buffet or counter.
A blow or cuff with or as if with the hand, or by any other solid object or the wind.
To strike with a buffet; to cuff; to slap.
To aggressively challenge, denounce, or criticise.
To affect as with blows; to strike repeatedly; to strive with or contend against.
definitions.example: to buffet the billows

definitions.definition: To deaden the sound of (bells) by muffling the clapper.
A low stool; a hassock.
A reduction in carbon dioxide emission by a third party purchased by a heavy carbon dioxide producer as part of carbon emissions trading.
The five players (the center, the two offensive guards and the two offensive tackles) lined up on the middle of the offensive side within a yard of the line of scrimmage
The seven legally obligatory players lined up on the offensive side within a yard of the line of scrimmage
All the offensive players, whether obligatory or not, lined up one yard or less from the offensive line of scrimmage
Determined to advance one's own personality or views
A dried stalk of a cereal plant.
Such dried stalks considered collectively.
A drinking straw.
A pale, yellowish beige colour, like that of a dried straw.
Anything proverbially worthless; the least possible thing.
To lay straw around plants to protect them from frost.
To sell straws on the streets in order to cover the giving to the purchaser of things usually banned, such as pornography.
Made of straw.
definitions.example: straw hat

definitions.definition: Of a pale, yellowish beige colour, like that of a dried straw.
Imaginary, but presented as real.
definitions.example: A straw enemy built up in the media to seem like a real threat, which then collapses like a balloon.

definitions.definition: A glossy magazine.
definitions.example: The supermarket glossies are full of celebrity gossip and fad diets.

definitions.definition: A glossy photograph.
A film depicting people with glamorous lifestyles.
Having a smooth, silk-like, reflective surface.
Automated teller machine.
Having no back, said of things that typically have backs, such as chairs or dresses
definitions.example: a backless surgical gown

definitions.definition: (of a person) having an uncovered back, having a back that shows skin
A man with extraordinarily broad and comprehensive knowledge.
A measure of weight containing 100 avoirdupois pounds (45.5 kg).
A measure of weight containing 8 stone or 112 avoirdupois pounds (51 kg).
(defective) To use caution, pay attention to (used both with and without of).
A French dance, in either 4/4 or 2/2 time.
To perform this dance.

Anethum graveolens (the type species of the genus Anethum), a herb, the seeds of which are moderately warming, pungent, and aromatic, formerly used as a soothing medicine for children; also known as dillseed.
A cucumber pickled with dill flavoring
A fool.
To cook or flavor with dill
To still; to assuage; to calm; to soothe, as one in pain.
A point in between moving and stationary parts of a machine where an individual's body part may become caught, leading to injury
The level of inventories of a commodity or product below which consumers become concerned about security of supply
Cuspidal point, a type of singular point on an algebraic surface
A kerb extension, a traffic calming measure consisting of an angled narrowing of the roadway
A bottleneck, part of a process that is too slow and causes a delay.
A plant, Foeniculum vulgare, of the parsley family, which has a sweet, anise-like flavor.
The bulb, leaves, or stalks of the plant, eaten as a vegetable.
The seeds of the fennel plant used as a spice in cooking.
A room reserved and equipped for the handling of major incidents, such as flooding or pandemic.
The transmission of an illness through unknown untraced members of the greater community, indicative of a reservoir of anonymous infected individuals.
Belief in the principles of left-wing politics.
Shoulder.
The pin or spindle on which a wheel revolves, or which revolves with a wheel.
A transverse bar or shaft connecting the opposite wheels of a car or carriage; an axletree.
An axis.
definitions.example: the Sun's axle

definitions.definition: An annual Asian plant (Cicer arietinum) in the pea family, widely cultivated for the edible seeds in its short inflated pods.
A seed of this plant, often used as a food.
definitions.example: Chickpea is valued for its nutritive seeds with high protein content.

definitions.definition: Items of clothing appropriate for swimming
Endurance of evil, suffering etc.
The allowance of something not explicitly approved; tolerance, forbearance.
Specifically, the allowance by a government (or other ruling power) of the exercise of religion beyond the state established faith.
Holidaying in a caravan, either mobile or in a permanent site
To be suitable for.
definitions.example: It fits the purpose.

definitions.definition: To conform to in size and shape.
definitions.example: If I lose a few kilos, the gorgeous wedding dress might fit me.

definitions.definition: To be of the right size and shape
definitions.example: I wanted to borrow my little sister's jeans, but they didn't fit.

definitions.definition: (with to) To make conform in size and shape.
definitions.example: I want to fit the drapes to the windows.

definitions.definition: To be in agreement with.
definitions.example: These definitions fit most of the usage.

definitions.definition: To adjust.
definitions.example: The regression program fit a line to the data.

definitions.definition: To attach, especially when requiring exact positioning or sizing.
To equip or supply.
definitions.example: The chandler will fit us with provisions for a month.

definitions.definition: To make ready.
definitions.example: I'm fitting the ship for a summer sail home.

definitions.definition: To be seemly.
To be proper or becoming.
To be in harmony.
definitions.example: The paint, the fabrics, the rugs all fit.

definitions.definition: To suffer a fit.
(of a kitchen, bathroom, etc.) Incorporating all of the fittings into connected units.
To be unsuccessful.
definitions.example: Throughout my life, I have always failed.

definitions.definition: Not to achieve a particular stated goal. (Usage note: The direct object of this word is usually an infinitive.)
definitions.example: The truck failed to start.

definitions.definition: To neglect.
definitions.example: The report fails to take into account all the mitigating factors.

definitions.definition: Of a machine, etc.: to cease to operate correctly.
definitions.example: After running five minutes, the engine failed.

definitions.definition: To be wanting to, to be insufficient for, to disappoint, to desert.
To receive one or more non-passing grades in academic pursuits.
definitions.example: I failed English last year.

definitions.definition: To give a student a non-passing grade in an academic endeavour.
definitions.example: The professor failed me because I did not complete any of the course assignments.

definitions.definition: To miss attaining; to lose.
To be wanting; to fall short; to be or become deficient in any measure or degree up to total absence.
definitions.example: The crops failed last year.

definitions.definition: To be affected with want; to come short; to lack; to be deficient or unprovided; used with of.
To fall away; to become diminished; to decline; to decay; to sink.
To deteriorate in respect to vigour, activity, resources, etc.; to become weaker.
definitions.example: A sick man fails.

definitions.definition: To perish; to die; used of a person.
To err in judgment; to be mistaken.
To become unable to meet one's engagements; especially, to be unable to pay one's debts or discharge one's business obligation; to become bankrupt or insolvent.
Weakness; defect
definitions.example: His worst failing is his temper.

definitions.definition: If the preferred or prior option is not possible
definitions.example: A large proportion of the females employed in other firms are said to have signified their intention of going on strike, failing a settlement.

definitions.definition: A sudden attack, especially an air raid; usually with reference to the Blitz.
A swift and overwhelming attack or effort.
definitions.example: We embarked on a publicity blitz, putting posters and flyers all around town.

definitions.definition: A play in which additional defenders beyond the defensive linemen rush the passer.
Blitz chess, a form of chess with a short time limit for moves.
To attack quickly or suddenly, as by an air raid or similar action.
To perform a blitz.
definitions.example: The Washington High defense almost always blitzes on third down.

definitions.definition: To purée or chop (food products) using a food processor or blender.
definitions.example: To make nut roast, you have to blitz the nuts in the food processor before adding the parsley and breadcrumbs.

definitions.definition: To do something quickly or in one session.
Robbery at sea, a violation of international law; taking a ship away from the control of those who are legally entitled to it.
definitions.example: How should the international community respond to Somali piracy?

definitions.definition: A similar violation of international law, such as hijacking of an aircraft.
The unauthorized duplication of goods protected by intellectual property law.
definitions.example: Some video game consoles use specially designed cartridges to make software piracy more difficult.

definitions.definition: The operation of an unlicensed radio or television station.
Kleptoparasitism.
A tropical perennial American vine, Ipomoea batatas, having a fleshy tuber.
The tuber of this plant cooked as a vegetable.
An ocarina.
Land, and all the built structures on it, especially when considered as a single place.
The subject of a conveyance or deed
A proposition antecedently supposed or proved; something previously stated or assumed as the basis of further argument; a condition; a supposition.
Any of the first propositions of a syllogism, from which the conclusion is deduced.

(usually in the plural) Matters previously stated or set forth; especially, that part in the beginning of a deed, the office of which is to express the grantor and grantee, and the land or thing granted or conveyed, and all that precedes the habendum; the thing demised or granted.
(usually in the plural) A piece of real estate; a building and its adjuncts.
definitions.example: trespass on another’s premises

definitions.definition: (authorship) The fundamental concept that drives the plot of a film or other story.
